text.0:
A Facebook post with results of a survey forecasting the outcome of the 2021 presidential election in Uganda is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Research World International, the survey company to whom the results are attributed, has distanced itself from the poll: https://t.co/FumZr29FKz
text.1:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Google form claiming to advertise job opportunities at supermarket chain Carrefour is fake.

:warning_selector: The retailer does not require job seekers to pay a registration fee and conducts recruitment with two accredited agencies: https://t.co/1Y0H64nm64
text.2:
An image shared on Facebook claiming to show people holding a banner with the words “Satan loves Kamala” is ALTERED.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The image combines a photo featuring US vice president-elect Kamala Harris with a photo in which the text has been manipulated: https://t.co/UH3ER28Tfq
text.3:
Phoney polls and supermarket scams are just some of the things we investigated this week.

:detective_medium-dark_skin_tone: Here are fact-checks of a few of this week's most outrageous claims:
